channel.title: CVE Feed for scottopolis -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for scottopolis -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-4214|2024-08-02T07:17:12.135Z -- scottopolis -- apppresser%20%E2%80%93%20mobile%20app%20framework
item.description: The AppPresser plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized password resets in versions up to, and including 4.2.5. This is due to the plugin generating too weak a reset code, and the code used to reset the password has no attempt or time limit.

item.title: CVE-2024-4611|2024-08-01T20:47:41.366Z -- scottopolis -- apppresser%20%E2%80%93%20mobile%20app%20framework
item.description: The AppPresser plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to improper missing encryption exception handling on the 'decrypt_value' and on the 'doCookieAuth' functions in all versions up to, and including, 4.3.2. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to log in as any existing user on the site, such as an administrator, if they previously used the login via the plugin API. This can only be exploited if the 'openssl' php extension is not loaded on the server.

item.title: CVE-2024-4611|2024-06-04T17:56:31.986Z -- scottopolis -- apppresser%20%E2%80%93%20mobile%20app%20framework
item.description: The AppPresser plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to improper missing encryption exception handling on the 'decrypt_value' and on the 'doCookieAuth' functions in all versions up to, and including, 4.3.2. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to log in as any existing user on the site, such as an administrator, if they previously used the login via the plugin API. This can only be exploited if the 'openssl' php extension is not loaded on the server.
